name: Tim's Seafood Pizza
author: Tim Huffman
summary: This was an experiment that went wonderfully well! Lobster, shrimp, spinach, roasted garlic, mayo, and some cheeses ... you got it! How can that not be good?
ingredients: 3 cloves garlic, peeled, or to taste
2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided, or to taste
1 pinch garlic salt, or to taste
¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese, or to taste
¾ cup shredded Italian cheese blend, or to taste
1 (12 ounce) lobster tail - shelled, cleaned, and diced
1 (2.25 ounce) can sliced black olives, or to taste
½ teaspoon seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®), or to taste
kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C)
Place garlic in a small stainless steel bowl; drizzle with 1 tablespoon olive oil and cover with aluminum foil
Bake in the preheated oven until tender and browned, about 1 hour
Increase oven temperature to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Grease a 10x12-inch pan with the remaining olive oil; sprinkle lightly with garlic salt
Mix spinach, mayonnaise, and Parmesan cheese together in a bowl
Spread mixture over the pizza crust
Sprinkle chopped roasted garlic along the edges of the crust
Cover with 1/2 the Italian cheese blend
Sprinkle on onions on top and the remaining Italian cheese blend
Drizzle with the remaining oil; sprinkle seafood seasoning, salt, and pepper on top
Bake in the preheated oven until crust is golden brown and lobster and shrimp are opaque, 10 to 12 minutes
